To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

nodes.body: :v: mo271 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7086038722/job/19283478596)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7086038722/job/19283478814)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7086038722/job/19283478358)
Why not `ψ (-x) = - ψ x` (same for the next lemma)? As elements of `ZMod m`, `m = 0`.
good point, I simplified it and replace "sub" by "neg" in the names

Please rename these lemmas so that they can be used with dot notation. So
```suggestion
lemma Odd.toUnitHom_eval_neg_one (hψ : ψ.Odd) : ψ.toUnitHom (-1) = -1 := by
  rw [← Units.eq_iff, MulChar.coe_toUnitHom]
  exact hψ

lemma Even.toUnitHom_eval_neg_one (hψ : ψ.Even) : ψ.toUnitHom (-1) = 1 := by
  rw [← Units.eq_iff, MulChar.coe_toUnitHom]
  exact hψ

lemma Odd.eval_neg (x : ZMod m) (hψ : ψ.Odd) : ψ (- x) = - ψ x := by
  rw [Odd] at hψ
  rw [← neg_one_mul, map_mul]
  simp [hψ]

lemma Even.eval_neg (x : ZMod m) (hψ : ψ.Even) : ψ (- x) = ψ x := by
```
